Violation_Type: Failure to meet criteria for Convention refugee status
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding that the applicants did not have a well-founded fear of persecution
Application_Facts: Applicants are of Romani ethnicity and claim discrimination and fear of persecution in Hungary
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision upheld; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision
Court_Ruling: The Board's decision was reasonable and did not err in law
Defendant_Behavior: Hungarian state providing protection mechanisms against discrimination
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under the Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Assessment_Factor: Existence of state protection, severity of discrimination vs. persecution
Evidence_Used: Incidents of discrimination reported in Hungary
Legal_Provision_Cited: Definition of 'Convention refugee' under the Immigration Act
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on ethnic origin
Governing_Rule: A Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution due to race, religion, nationality, membership in a particular social group, or political opinion
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing persecution rather than discrimination
Insufficient proof of state protection failure
Harm_Assessment: Discrimination experienced but not rising to level of persecution
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status due to discrimination and fear of persecution based on Romani ethnicity in Hungary
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed evidence of discrimination and state protection mechanisms
Evidence_Issues: Dispute over whether systemic discrimination constitutes persecution
Effectiveness of legal remedies in Hungary
Legal_Provision: Section defining Convention refugee in the Immigration Act
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Courtâ€™s jurisdiction to review IRB decisions under the Federal Court Act
Evidence_Assessment: Board found incidents of discrimination but no persecution
Decision_Rationale: Discrimination does not equate to persecution; state protection in Hungary is adequate
Evidentiary_Issues: Applicants failed to demonstrate that discrimination amounted to persecution
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution standard under international refugee law
